samples.context: In a family, kids know that if they eat their vegetables, they can have dessert after dinner. Parents know that if they take the kids to the park, the kids will play on the playground equipment. Either the kids eat vegetables, or they don't get to play at the park.
samples.question: The parents took their kids to the park today. Did the kids have desert for dinner?

samples.context: In a city, residents know that if it rains a lot, there will be flooding. If there is a flood warning, people should evacuate low-lying areas. Either it rained heavily, or there people did not evacuate the low-lying areas.
samples.question: There was a flood warning. Did the city flood?

samples.context: At a party, guests know that if they bring a dish to share, there will be enough food for everyone. If it is a birthday party, there will be cake and ice cream. Either someone brought a dish to share, or there was no birthday cake.
samples.question: It is Sam's birthday party. Does Sam have enough food for everyone to eat?

samples.context: At a school, students know that if they study hard, they will get good grades. If there is a snow day, school will be canceled. Either someone studies diligently last night, or school was not called off today.
samples.question: School was canceled due to snow today. Did Sam get good grades?

samples.context: At a school, students know that if they study hard for an exam, they will get a good grade. If there is a snow day, school gets cancelled. Either someone did not study hard, or school was not cancelled, or they did not study hard and school was still open.
samples.question: There was a snow day today. Did Mary get a good grade on her exam?

samples.context: In a small town, people know that if the fire alarm sounds, then there is a fire emergency. When children are at school, if there is a fire drill scheduled for that day, the principal makes an announcement over the loudspeaker before the alarm sounds. Either the fire alarm went off today, or there was no fire drill.
samples.question: There were children at school today. Was there a fire emergency?

samples.context: In a sport, athletes know that if they train hard, they will perform well in competitions. If an athlete gets injured, then they need to rest and recover. Either the athletes train hard, or they do not need to recover from injury.
samples.question: Megan got injured. Did she perform well in her event?

samples.context: In the morning, students realize that if they study hard for a test, they will get a good grade. Separately, the principal knows that if there is bad weather, school will be canceled. Either the students studied hard, or school was not canceled.
samples.question: There was bad weather. Did Alex get a good grade on his test?

samples.context: Players know that if they practice hard, their skills will improve. Also, if it is a championship game, the stakes are high. Either the player practiced hard, or the stakes were not high.
samples.question: It was a championship game. Did the player's skills improve?

samples.context: At home, people know that if they do laundry, they will have clean clothes. If they order pizza delivery, then they tip the driver. Either someone did laundry today, or they did not tip the pizza driver.
samples.question: Lisa ordered pizza tonight. Does she have clean clothes to wear?

samples.context: Chefs know that if they use fresh ingredients, the food will taste delicious. Also, if they cook a complicated recipe, it takes more time to prepare. Either the chef used fresh ingredients.
samples.question: If the chef cooked a complicated recipe, did the food taste delicious?

samples.context: In a city, residents know that if it rains, the grass gets wet. If there is a festival, then the streets get crowded. Either it rained today, or the streets were not crowded.
samples.question: There was a festival in town today. Is the grass wet?

samples.context: In a city, people know that if it rains, the grass and plants will be watered naturally. Also, if the weather is very hot, then children will play in sprinklers outside to cool off. Either it rained today, or the children did not play in sprinklers.
samples.question: The weather was very hot. Did the grass and plants get watered naturally today?

samples.context: In a workplace, employees know that if they attend the staff meeting, they will get updates on company news. If the CEO attends the meet, then there will be special food. Either the staff meeting was held, or the meeting did not have special food.
samples.question: The Ceo attended the meeting today. Did Susan, an employee get updates at the staff meeting?

samples.context: In a small town, people know that if there is a war, the food supply will get cut off. If the people are stuck, the mayor will order an emergency rescue. Either the country X was engaging in war, or there was no eemergency rescue.
samples.question: The people are stuck in between the war today. Did the food supply get cut off?
